keyword: how many calories in a martini
title: How Many Calories Are in a Martini?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a martini, including carbs, alcohol content, and variations for dry or dirty styles in this quick nutrition guide.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Martini?
assumptions: Standard dry martini: 2.5 oz gin or vodka, 0.5 oz dry vermouth, stirred or shaken, no garnishes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brands, pour size, vermouth amount, and garnishes. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A standard dry martini contains about 176 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Vodka martini (vs. gin, no other changes)

faqs.q: How many calories in a dry martini?
faqs.a: About 176 kcal for a standard dry martini with 2.5 oz gin and 0.5 oz vermouth.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a martini?
faqs.a: Minimal—around 0.5 g carbs from vermouth, with no fiber or significant sugars.

faqs.q: How does a dirty martini affect calories?
faqs.a: Adding olive brine increases calories by ~10-20 kcal depending on amount.

faqs.q: Is a martini low in fat or protein?
faqs.a: Yes—0 g fat and 0 g protein; calories come almost entirely from alcohol.

faqs.q: What changes the calorie count in a martini?
faqs.a: Vermouth quantity, spirit type, garnishes like olives, or sweetness level can vary totals by 50+ kcal.
